meanings.sent1: Many birds inhabited the trees in the forest.
meanings.sent2: People inhabited the ancient caves thousands of years ago.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to inhabit the picnic basket for the day.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were inhabited by memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The old house was inhabited by friendly spirits.

meanings.sent1: The family inhabited a cozy cottage by the lake.
meanings.sent2: The nomadic tribe would inhabit different regions based on the season.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loved to inhabit the warm laundry basket.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to inhabit a world of its own creation.
meanings.sent5: The ghost was said to inhabit the abandoned mansion on the hill.

meanings.sent1: The small island was inhabited by friendly villagers.
meanings.sent2: The dense forest was inhabited by various wildlife.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house was said to be inhabited by restless spirits.
meanings.sent4: The bustling city was inhabited by people from all walks of life.
